case_vignette: A 78-year-old male presents to the emergency room with crampy abdominal pain and bloating. His last bowel movement was three days ago and he has not passed gas over the same time period. His past medical history is notable for Alzheimer's disease, hypertension, and stable angina. He takes donezepil, aspirin, enalapril, and metoprolol. His temperature is 100.8°F (38.2°C), blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 110/min, and respirations are 24/min. On examination, his abdomen is notably distended and tender to palpation. A frontal abdominal radiograph is shown in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
